What to do with overly talkative and disruptive members?  Many times there will 
be group members who love to talk non-stop.  This disrupts the effectiveness of group discussion.  Listed below are guidelines for CHW and CV to deal with such 
situations:
✱  The talkative member/group should not be asked any more questions. If the 
person or group answers all the questions directed to the others, answer 
from another person should be sought specifically.  For example, one may 
turn to the opposite side and ask, “Does anyone on this side of the table have any ideas?”
✱  The talkative person or group should be politely told that “You have had an opportunity to express your ideas. Now, let’s hear from others what they have 
to say on this point.” Then the trainer should rephrase the question and invite 
other members to respond or address the question specifically to a person.
